document_data.name: Liberators of the Steel Sky
document_data.orgname: the Liberators of the Steel Sky
document_data.mainbody: The '''Liberators of the Steel Sky''' were a group of young dragonborn rebels who defied the dragonborn social norms and tried to breach the barriers between [[Abeir]] and [[Toril]] in [[1486 DR]].
document_data.Beliefs: Members of the Liberators believed that Abeir was the rightful place were dragonborn should be, a place were they would be masters of their own destiny, instead of unwelcomed guests of the inhabitants of Toril. They also wanted to be reunited with their "lost" brethren of [[Tymanchebar]].
document_data.Membership: All members of the Liberators were rebellious young of many [[Thymari]] clans, including members of [[Clan Kepeshkmolik]], [[Clan Shestandeliath]] and [[Clan Verthisathurgiesh]].
document_data.History: On [[Nightal 15]] of 1486 DR, members of the Liberators accomplished the impossible and opened a portal to Abeir—thanks to the weakening of the dimensional barrier as part of the [[Second Sundering]]—in the [[Catacombs (Djerad Thymar)|Catacombs]] of [[Djerad Thymar]], believing they would save the [[dragonborn]] inhabitants of that world. was accidentally sent to [[Toril]] through the portal, and killed nearly all members of the Liberators, before he went on to carry out his mission on Djerad Thymar instead.
document_data.Known members:
* [[Kepeshkmolik Dumuzi]] (retired prior the group's destruction)
* [[Shestandeliath Parvida]]
* [[Shestandeliath Ravar]]
* [[Shestandeliath Zaroshni]]
* [[Verthisathurgiesh Baruz]]
